TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WorkflowStatus extends System.Enum

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Specifies the status of a workflow instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](../../add/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can use the WorkflowStatus values to set the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingQueryOptions.WorkflowStatus%2A> property. Each value constrains the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Tracking.SqlTrackingWorkflowInstance> in a different way.
This code example is part of the Workflow Monitor SDK Sample from the DatabaseService.cs file. For more information, see [Workflow Monitor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#127](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets1.cs#127)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#127](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets1.vb#127)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus Completed = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus Created = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The workflow instance has been created by a call to one of the overloaded M:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowRuntime.CreateWorkflow(System.Type)?qualifyHint=True

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus Running = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus Suspended = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The workflow instance has been suspended by a T:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.SuspendActivity?qualifyHint=False

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowStatus Terminated = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The workflow instance has been terminated by a

remarks.format: ## Remarks T:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.TerminateActivity?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True activity, by a call to M:System.Workflow.Runtime.WorkflowInstance.Terminate(System.String)?qualifyHint=True&autoUpgrade=True, or by the workflow runtime engine.
